attributes.action: Publicly apologize to every UK pensioner for his £17,000 tax raid on private pension schemes whilst his Gold Plated pension remains blast proof
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Gordon Brown was solely responsible when he was chancellor in 1997 when he decided to axe tax relief on dividends paid to pension funds?

This one action alone has been currently estimated to have cost private occupational schemes £175 billion.Does he now have the courage to admit to the Private Pension Scheme members he was wrong,
could he also please explain where he as spent the above amount ? ,and please give a honest answer? 
If Gordon Brown would rather pass on the above request.
Tony Blair may like to reply?
